item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leaks Paint a Bleak Picture For a Recurring Issue
item.description:
Honkai: Star Rail has a diverse roster of characters, all wielding unique abilities to form strong team compositions and define the game's meta. But, as many avid players have noticed, Honkai: Star Rail seems to have put off releasing 4-star characters in the last few updates.

In the past, Honkai: Star Rail would release at least one new 4-star character along with new 5-star characters in every update. These 4-star characters are later included in the standard banner and even given away for free during select limited-time events. But Honkai: Star Rail is slowing down on the release of 4-star characters, so much that 5-stars have outnumbered them. Based on recent leaks, this trend doesn't seem to be slowing down anytime soon.

Honkai: Star Rail Continues to Put New 4-Star Characters in the Backburner

As mentioned, Honkai: Star Rail used to be more consistent with its release of new 4-star characters. Compared to its launch year in 2023, which had at least one new 4-star unit every month, Honkai: Star Rail only released a total of four 4-star characters in 2024. Half of them, namely Gallagher and Misha, were part of the larger Penacony main story, so it made sense for them to be playable. Meanwhile, the other two, Moze and March 7th's The Hunt form, became playable during the Xianzhou Wardance arc later that year.

Gallagher

Fire, Path of Abundance

Misha

Ice, Path of Destruction

Moze

Lightning, Path of The Hunt

March 7th (The Hunt)

Imaginary, Path of The Hunt

With Honkai: Star Rail currently in its Amphoreus arc, the characters released and revealed so far are all 5-stars, including Saber and Archer from the upcoming Fate/Stay Night collaboration. Recent leaks have also hinted at future characters who are said to be 5-star units as well, so it might be safe to assume that there might not be any 4-star characters during the entirety of the Amphoreus journey. If there are, it's likely going to be a small number, just like last year.

The leaks paint a bleak picture of one of Honkai: Star Rail 's recurring issues, further proving that it might be focusing more on 5-star characters in future updates from now on. This could particularly be disadvantageous to newer players, who might feel like they need to keep pulling in Honkai: Star Rail 's Warp banners to get good 5-star characters to stabilize their teams, especially since there's an impression that 4-star characters aren't as powerful.

On the one hand, 4-star characters mostly serve as early-game placeholders for 5-star damage-dealers and healers that players don't have yet. Many of Honkai: Star Rail 's 4-star characters are actually pretty good, with the likes of Tingyun and Gallagher being some of the best. Some also complement certain 5-star characters, like March 7th's The Hunt form pairs well with Feixiao because they can stack each other's meters with their follow-up attacks. The lack of new 4-star characters doesn't significantly affect Honkai: Star Rail 's gameplay, especially for fans who have been playing since day one and have been using strong 5-star characters to fight strong bosses and complete endgame content.

Perhaps Honkai: Star Rail isn't in a hurry to release more 4-star characters because it has already reached its cap, and is probably focusing on refining its future 5-star characters, including the alternate forms of certain units. Granted, there is enough to satisfy both old and new players who are looking for characters to fill the gaps in their teams if needed, and Honkai: Star Rail has been giving away 4-stars for free in various events to make it easier for players to complete their characters' Eidolon levels. Still, it's understandable why many players prefer having more new 4-star characters to further diversify the pool, and slowing down their release could stagnate it at some point.

item.title: WWE 2K25 Contains a Hall of Fame Error
item.description:
Summary

  • WWE 2K25 mistakenly calls the late Brian Pillman a WWE Hall of Famer.
  • The game features over 300 playable wrestlers, including new additions like Pillman's son Lexis King.
  • Fans speculate Pillman may be included in a future Hall of Fame class.

WWE 2K25 contains a line of voiced dialogue that incorrectly identifies Brian Pillman as a member of the WWE Hall of Fame. While the late Brian Pillman doesn't appear in WWE 2K25 , his real-life son does, and a recorded line from longtime commentator Michael Cole piles an accolade on Pillman's career that has yet to be bestowed.

The roster of WWE 2K25 boasts the largest selection of wrestlers of any game in the franchise's history, with more than 300 playable wrestlers. That number includes active members of the RAW, SmackDown, and NXT rosters, legends of the past, and original creations from the development team at Visual Concepts.

Pillman, a former tag team partner and rival of Stone Cold Steve Austin who tragically passed away of a heart attack while under contract with WWE in 1997 at the age of 35, isn't among that number, but his real-life son, Lexis King, is one of more than 30 new wrestlers in WWE 2K25 's base game roster. As pointed out by Reddit user Sad-Ladder7534, a line of in-ring commentary delivered by Cole identifies King as the son of a WWE Hall of Fame member. Pillman began his wrestling career with WCW in 1989, forming The Hollywood Blonds alongside Austin in 1993, but fans of WWE specifically may remember him for his intense feud with Austin and his affiliation with The Hart Foundation in the mid '90s. While fans of the Attitude Era likely have vivid memories of Pillman's work, he has never been inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame.

WWE 2K25 May Hint at Future Hall of Fame Inductee

The WWE Hall of Fame induction ceremony is held in April of each year, usually just before the annual WrestleMania event. WWE 2K25 was released on March 14, just over a month before this year's ceremony, but Pillman was not included in this year's Hall of Fame class. While the game includes other immersion errors, including weird typos on WWE wrestlers' clothing and The Rock removing the wrong elbow pad when performing The People's Elbow, at least one fan believes the voiced line may be a hint at Pillman's posthumous inclusion in a later Hall of Fame class.

This player also wonders whether Pillman may appear as a surprise release in an upcoming WWE 2K25 DLC pack. Pillman's estate reached a Legacy Contract with WWE in 2024, allowing for new merchandise featuring his name and likeness, and while there are still two special celebrity guests yet to be revealed in the DLC release schedule, Pillman's name has not been officially mentioned.

item.title: 'You Gamers Are Crazy' TikToker Gets Toxic Messages Because She Doesn't Know About Video Games
item.description:
Summary

  • A TikToker was attacked for lacking knowledge about video games.
  • The TikToker asked for help to understand video games, receiving both support and backlash.
  • Positive responses from users encouraged learning instead of attacking, and suggesting games for the TikToker to enjoy.

A TikTok user has been verbally attacked over a lack of knowledge about video games. For decades, video game adaptations were generally disregarded, but that has changed in recent years. We are experiencing a golden age of video game adaptations with the likes of the wildly successful Super Mario Bros. Movie , the critically-acclaimed Fallout series on Amazon, and, of course, The Last of Us on HBO. Projects like these are helping people that may have never really played video games discover the medium. Unfortunately, the gaming community hasn't always been welcoming to these newcomers, as one TikTok user recently found out.

TikToker taloredwards made a viral video asking her viewers to explain video games. Using The Last of Us HBO series as an example, she asked, "What do you guys mean, 'Oh, this happens in the game.' To my knowledge, video games are a player-by-player, case-by-case thing. When guys are on 2K , Call of Duty , all that stuff, isn't it like each player's own experience? I don't get, 'Oh, this happens to Joel in the game' or 'Ellie does this in the game.' So, the whole plot is the same for every player? Then how is it a game then? I sound so stupid. Please don't cuss me out. I really do not get it." The video has amassed over 224,000 views at the time of this writing.

After posting the video, the TikToker received messages stating that she should "unalive" herself because she didn't know about video games. "You gamers are crazy," she said in the follow-up video. In that same video, taloredwards explained that she has never played video games before and was "genuinely asking." She then thanked the people that stitched the video and answered her question. "I get it now. I don't even want to learn how to play video games. You guys are insane." While many of the nearly 7,000 comments on the original video are helpful and understanding, there are those that attacked taloredwards over her lack of knowledge about video games.

TikToker Asks About Video Games, Gets Attacked

If someone has never played video games before, it would make sense that they would not be aware of what a video game entails. After all, video game depictions in movies and TV are hardly ever an accurate representation, and it seems those around her primarily played multiplayer games. While it's OK to be surprised that someone doesn't know that there are story-based games, attacking someone over it is wild and unfortunate. On the bright side, many of the comments on the follow-up video were positive. Some apologized for the actions of "toxic" people that commented on the original video. User Willie Botello said, "Real gamers will help you out and support you, everyone with the hate comments are not real gamers." User Katie Johnson said, "The ones that insulted you are not gamers." User Fed said, "The gaming community just fumbled."

Some left suggestions on games that taloredwards should try. One suggested that she play cozy games, while another said she should try Animal Crossing . Another said that she should buy a PlayStation 5 and play through The Last of Us games to go through the "emotional roller coaster."

item.title: New Report Paints Bleak Picture of Upcoming PlayStation Exclusive
item.description:
Summary

  • Upcoming PlayStation live-service title Fairgames reportedly saw mixed reactions in closed playtesting.
  • Fairgames' gameplay loop is apparently a mix of Fortnite and The Division, with the playtest build described as "super clunky."
  • The founder of Fairgames developer Haven Studios left the team last week, further adding to the list of concerns surrounding the game.

It seems like PlayStation's upcoming live-service title Fairgames is not faring very well in closed playtesting, as per a recent report. Fairgames developer Haven Studios saw a major leadership shake-up just last week, and now, there are signs that the game itself could join the growing list of PlayStation's doomed live-service projects.

Revealed at the 2023 PlayStation Showcase, Fairgames is a live-service heist shooter in the works at Haven Studios, a team founded and formerly led by Assassin's Creed veteran Jade Raymond. Sony joined forces with Raymond in 2021 to help set up Haven Studios, and the team was eventually acquired by the gaming giant in 2022 to expand PlayStation's live-service portfolio. However, after Concord 's historic failure last year, the pressure on Fairgames to perform well has increased greatly, and Haven might be buckling under the stress.

No new footage or gameplay of Fairgames has been shown since its original debut, and on May 16, 2025, Jade Raymond exited Haven Studios, inciting more concerns surrounding internal confidence in the live-service title. While Sony affirmed that it remains committed to Haven and Fairgames , some new info from Last Stand Media's paywalled Sacred Symbols podcast (episode 360) spells out more worrisome news. Apparently, a pre-alpha version of Fairgames - dubbed Project Hearts - was quietly distributed to a small group of playtesters via PSN, and the feedback from this early test has been far from encouraging .

Fairgames is Ostensibly a "Super Clunky" Cross Between Extraction Shooters and Battle Royales

Described as a hybrid of Fortnite and The Division , Fairgames reportedly drops players into large urban maps in teams of three to four. The objective is to infiltrate vaults and steal from the wealthy, while rival teams attempt the same in real time - a gameplay loop that sits somewhere between an extraction shooter and a battle royale. Though the concept promises a stylized, Robin Hood-style experience, the playtesters described Fairgames ' gameplay as "super clunky" and devoid of polish.

These alleged details about Fairgames don't quite paint an encouraging picture for the game, especially in light of Concord being one of the most high-profile flops in Sony's history and the numerous live-service project cancelations at PlayStation first-party studios like Naughty Dog, Bend Studio, Bluepoint Games, and more. On the other hand, it's worth noting that Project Hearts was a pre-alpha build of Fairgames , and Haven could have incorporated feedback and addressed the concerns. With a rumored internal launch window of 2026, only time will tell if Haven has been able to mature Fairgames into a commendable experience.

item.title: Fantasy Life I: Fangshore Isles Leafe Locations
item.description:
Ginormosia is the biggest region in Fantasy Life I with many different areas, each hosting different types of trees or monsters, but there are also a few things that all areas share in common: Shrines, Googlancia Towers, and Leafes. All of these must be discovered by exploring the districts of Ginormosia, as none of them are marked by default on the map.

Leafes are the most difficult creatures to find in every region. A Leafe is a cute small creature with a leaf on its tail, but it is stuck inside the ground, and only its tail is out. Each Leafe has a different tail shape, but players can easily identify them, though they are usually hidden in corners or some tricky spots. The good news is that once you rescue these Leafes, they will reward you with a random item. Here's where to find all of these creatures in the Fangshore Isles.

Fangshore Isles Leafe Locations In Fantasy Life I

Fangshore Isles is home to five Leafes in total, scattered around different parts of the area. From the small northern isle to the tip of the biggest island in the area, there are Leafes to rescue. The ones on the shorelines are easiest to discover, as there is no grass around and the Leafes are visible from afar.

First Leafe

At the northernmost part of Fangshore, there is a smaller island that is connected to the main body of the region by a narrow path. You will find the Leafe on the sothern end of the small island, within the grass field.

Second Leafe

North of Fangshore's primary island, there is a village with a watch tower . You can find the Leafe just behind the watchtower's wall.

Third Leafe

Head to the western shoreline of the biggest island in Fanshore Isles. As marked on the map, it's located pretty close to the beach, hugging the corner of a high cliff.

Fourth Leafe

Similar to the third Leafe, this one also hugsthe corner of a cliff, north of a small lake at the southern part of the main island.

Fifth Leafe

Move to the southernmost part of the main island in Fangshore, and you will spot the Leafe on the beach. It's the easiest one to discover, since there's no grass to hide the Leafe.

Rewards For Collecting Leafes

In addition to the random rewards that the player receives by helping each Leafe, if you go back to Fangshore's Googlancia Tower and interact with it after rescuing all the Leafes in the area, another random reward will be granted to you.

It's worth noting that Leafes are one-off collectibles, and they will not appear again by ranking up the district. While they are worthwhile collectibles earlier in the game, when the player levels up later on, the rewards won't look impressive anymore. However, it's still a fun activity to increase the Area Rank.
